results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 11
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Kenton from Nundawading who just loves life and the state of Victoria; a woman who has four deeply meaningful Rings; Nairee and Michelle from Traralgon tell us about ‘my dog Oscar’; and Adrian from Brunswick has a passion for Melbourne’s live music scene.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 10
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Michael who shares his love of imagination; Ivan and Luke really like Dinosaurs; Madelaine from Clayton is a BIG fan of Horses; and Michelle from Frankston’s favourite thing is absolutely the beach.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 1
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Norma from Swan Hill talking about a Mallee root; Alex from Melbourne discusses 19th century literature; Adam Elliott is still thrilled by his Oscar; Lewis loves the Spy Kids movies; Alfred of Reservoir tells us that retirement is his favourite thing and a visitor from Hong Kong bursts into song!

results.title: Victoria's favourite things
results.brief_description:
Check out what people brought to ACMI for July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’.
Recorded live in ACMI’s Screen Pit, the event was modelled on a 1960’s variety show and includes songs, stories, bad jokes and some really interesting stuff.

results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.

results.title: Victor/Victoria
results.creator_credit: Ladbroke Entertainment, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Blake Edwards and Tony Adams
results.brief_description: Sparkling, ultra-sophisticated entertainment from Blake Edwards. This story is based on a 1933 German comedy film “Viktor und Viktoria” written and directed by Rheinhold Schunzel. Set in Paris in 1934, it is the tale of a down-on-her luck chanteuse, played by Julie Andrews. Also suffering a temporary career lapse is tres gai nightclub entertainer (Robert Preston), who remakes her as a man who in short order becomes celebrated as Paris’s foremost female impersonator. In the process she snags the attentions of a Chicago nightclub owner (James Garner). He, however, has a small problem - is it a he or a she who has stolen his heart? 1982 Academy Award for Best Original Score (Henry Mancini). Academy Award nominations for Best Actress (Julie Andrews), Supporting Actor (Robert Preston), Supporting Actress (Lesley Anne Warren), Screenplay Adaptation, Costume Design and Art Direction.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Michael Relph, Parkway Films and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: Vicky
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Elsa Bolam and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
One of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults about teenage alienation. An unhappy suburban teenager whose affluent parents don’t get along, Vicki turns to an older man and a life of crime. Scenes in Vicky’s home clearly show the lack of communication between her parents, and between them and the girl.

results.title: Vicki (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A documentary approach to the problems encountered by Vicki, born without arms, and her ways of coping with work, family and her desires for marriage and a family. Produced for television as an introduction to social services available from Government agencies.

results.title: Vicki
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description: Vicki is born without arms and this documentary looks at her approach to life and her ways of coping with work, her future marriage, her desire for children and the way people treat her. One of a series of films originally created for a day-time television discussion panel which was designed to alert the public to the range of social services available from Government and other agencies. Suitable for secondary school level.
